page.title: 07FARMING KING'S NYMPTON
page.content: The land is used for {mixed farming. {Cattle}and{sheep}are kept and a small number of pigs.The chief crop in this area is {hay }and{silage}which is used for winter feeding.Dairy and beef cattle are reared. Recent E.E.C. milk quota regulations have led to a reduction in the number of dairy cows.Cereal crops are grown, much of it being stored in a large grain store in a neighbouring parish.Feeding methods for cows at Great Lightleigh Farm are linked with a computer system -each milking cow wears a neckband with a transponder.As the cow enters the feeding stall thetransponder emits signals which identify her.These are relayed to the computer which controls the feeding supply in relation to the milk yield. Farming is highly mechanised and this has led to a reduction of farm workers' jobs.
